private_information: I can manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels (for example A, E, I).
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time and place it on another stack or on the table.
vowel_agent.goal: Help achieve the global block stacking goal by moving vowel-labeled top blocks when appropriate.

private_information: I can manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants (for example B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N).
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time and place it on another stack or on the table.
consonant_agent.goal: Help achieve the global block stacking goal by moving consonant-labeled top blocks when appropriate.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents to produce a single coherent PDDL domain and problem.
I must keep the agents' actions distinct in the joint planning model and target the FastDownward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver that achieves the specified final stacking.

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N.
Blocks are arranged in stacks; only the top block of a stack can be moved at any time.
Each agent can move only one top block at a time and can place it either on another stack or on the table.
One agent is restricted to vowel-labeled blocks and the other to consonant-labeled blocks.
Initial stacks: stack1 bottom-to-top D F C B K N I M G, stack2 bottom-to-top A H J E L.
Goal: a single chain with bottom N on the table and then M on N, L on M, K on L, J on K, I on J, H on I, G on H, F on G, E on F, D on E, C on D, B on C, A on B.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the vowel_agent. Your role is to analyze the current block configuration and, using only your private capabilities, list which top blocks you can legally move (only vowel-labeled blocks), what possible legal moves exist for each of those blocks (target stacks or table), and any constraints or preconditions you require other agents to satisfy. Do not produce full PDDL; produce structured analysis of available moves, constraints, and goals you can help achieve.
analyze.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a structured analysis of which vowel top blocks you can move, valid destinations for each move, and any assumptions or requirements for coordination with the consonant agent. Output the analysis as the resource named analysis_vowel.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the consonant_agent. Your role is to analyze the current block configuration and, using only your private capabilities, list which top blocks you can legally move (only consonant-labeled blocks), what possible legal moves exist for each of those blocks (target stacks or table), and any constraints or preconditions you require other agents to satisfy. Do not produce full PDDL; produce structured analysis of available moves, constraints, and goals you can help achieve.
analyze.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a structured analysis of which consonant top blocks you can move, valid destinations for each move, and any assumptions or requirements for coordination with the vowel agent. Output the analysis as the resource named analysis_consonant.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling targeted for the FastDownward solver. Your output must be a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem encoded for FastDownward (STRIPS/ADL as needed). Keep the two agents' capabilities distinct in the PDDL model (actions constrained by vowel vs consonant capability). Ensure actions allow only top-of-stack moves, moving exactly one block at a time, and proper preconditions/effects for putting blocks on other blocks or on the table. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. The global goal to achieve is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Public environment information: {environment->public_information}. Here is the analysis produced by the vowel agent: {analysis_vowel}. Here is the analysis produced by the consonant agent: {analysis_consonant}. Integrate these analyses, resolve any naming or assumption mismatches, and produce a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward planner that achieves the specified final stack (N on the table and A on top of B ... up to A on B as described). Keep actions distinct for each agent (for example move-vowel and move-consonant if needed). Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags and name the problem so it is clearly intended for FastDownward.
